subject: Parenting
title: Magical Thinking
description: Learn Magical Thinking in one minute.

hook.text: A four-year-old believes stepping on a crack will literally break her mother's back.

buildup.text: Young children see the world as governed by wishes, rituals, and invisible forces.

discovery.text: Piaget called this the preoperational stage â€” logic hasn't overridden imagination yet.

twist.text: It's not foolishness. The brain hasn't built the circuits to separate cause from coincidence.

climax.text: Magical thinking fuels creativity and play. It fades naturally around age seven.

punchline.text: Every child lives where wishes have power.

quiz.question: When does magical thinking typically begin to fade?
